article:
'Rosie Bonds Kreidler' (born July 7, 1944) competed in the 1964 Summer Olympics
for the United States in the Women's 80 metre hurdles. She finished in 1st place
in the fourth heat of the first round (10.6 seconds), in 4th place in the first
semifinal (10.8 seconds), and in 8th place in the final race (10.8 seconds).
After retiring from athletics two years later, she started a career in nursing.

She is the sister of Bobby Bonds and the aunt of Barry Bonds and Bobby
Bonds, Jr..

In 2002, the automobile in which she was traveling was rammed by a tractor-
trailer, breaking her neck, back and ribs. The injury prevented her from
continuing her work as a nurse. When her insurance stopped paying for physical
therapy in 2005, Kreidler lived in her car and in the St. Mary's Center homeless
shelter. She said she was too proud to ask family members for help. She then
became an advocate for better care for seniors in Alameda County.
categories: Athletes (track and field) at the 1964 Summer Olympics
